Package org.jtrim2.access

Interface AccessChangeListener<IDType,RightType>

Type Parameters:
IDType - the type of the request id
RightType - the type of the right this listener can receive notifications of
public interface AccessChangeListener<IDType,RightType>
The listener interface for receiving notification of acquiring and releasing access tokens. This interface is intended to be used by access managers to notify clients that a certain token has been acquired or released.

Thread safety

Most implementation of this interface are not required to be thread-safe but an event provider (e.g.: an AccessManager) may define otherwise.

Synchronization transparency

Implementations of this listener are not required to be synchronization transparent however they must not wait for asynchronous events.

    void
    onChangeAccess(AccessRequest<? extends IDType,? extends RightType> request, boolean acquired)
    Invoked when an AccessToken gets acquired or released.

  • Method Details

    • onChangeAccess

      void onChangeAccess(AccessRequest<? extends IDType,? extends RightType> request, boolean acquired)
      Invoked when an AccessToken gets acquired or released. Note that, even if this event reports that an AccessToken got released, it does not imply that this request is now available. You have to verify it manually, that the rights you need are available or not.
      Parameters:
      request - the request used to acquire the AccessToken which has been acquired or released. This argument cannot be null.
      acquired - true if this notification is due to the AccessToken got acquired, false if it was just released.
